Don’t live your life for other people, live it for yourself. There is always another way to make it better for yourself.

Selfish (from the suicidal person) for not sticking around and living a miserable life for those that care about them. Selfless (from the suicidal person) because they may think that other people would be better off without them.

Question: Isn't it selfish of the person wanting the suicidal person to stick around and live miserably, in pain, suffering, etc. just so that they don't have to grieve their death?

if your near suicide and others can't help you, do some self-therapy. you can do it while sober or on psychadelics, psychs are powerful and can help you answer questions you need answers to. but research thoroughly before doing them

I think death is painful because our bodies secretly want to be alive.  I’ve heard that our digestive systems actually have more neurons than a dogs brain.  Maybe our stomachs just want to live so they can keep wallowing in masticated food slop.  It’s interesting to think of why people want to live.  I mean, people list all kinds of reasons, but I wonder if anyone really knows.  Is it just the fear of absence of consciousness?  Anyway, we are all going to die eventually.  I’m sorry you are feeling this way, too.  I can relate.  Pain is a powerful motivator.  I wish I had a “sleep” button.  Dreams are best.  Don’t seem to be depressed and hopeless in dreams. They just happen. Life just happens. Death too.  I hope you can seek out a way to ride out this life with putting yourself into these painful events.  Your stomach still wants to eat. Your lungs still want to breath. Your ears still want to hear and your eyes still want to see.  Your mind wants to dream also.  Sometimes our thinking and feeling mind can’t connect with all the other egos within us.  It’s severely depressing and depersonalizing.  I end up in vegetative states because of it, but when I’m in those I can’t even organize a suicide.  I’m hostage to all my other selves.  Trying different drugs and routines to try to connect the dots.  It’s hard though.  I hope you can hang on and keep trying. When I see someone else get better it gives me hope for myself.

I know that feeling of peace knowing that there's a way out. Who knows, maybe in 2 years you find a reason to keep living. And don't beat yourself up over college - your mental health is more important. Is there any way you can see a therapist if you want to?

I'm an 22-year-old Iranian girl and I absolutely know your pain brother. The pain is a burden we born with and must carry our whole life.
I'm an agnostic but my strictly religious parents force me to wear Chador and do all the stuff Muslims should do, because what other ppl would say about them if I wouldn't do this stuff? The whole thing is about them, always them, never me.

I'm an engineering student and I managed to get into a university that was far from the city my family lives in, so I would see them less often and could have more peace mentally, but because of this Covid-19 situation they forced us to flee our dorms and now I'm stuck in here with them again. We have an argument almost every day. We even had the same exact argument about cats.

I hate it here. I see no future for myself. How the hell could I ever afford to live independently? How the hell could I ever afford to own my place, to not be under their influence? My whole life is dedicated to leaving Iran because I know I have no chance for living a normal life here, but I know that my family won't support me by any means. We are not that poor of a family, we are middle class and the money that I need for immigration (let's say 40k USD at most), is just about 1/4 of the value of a flat of the entire building my parents own. But I know for a fact they will never help me, because my dad says "we should love our country and Islam, this is the best country in the world, USA is doomed to failure, we love our family and can't live without each other, etc". But guess what? I hate every single one of those things.

I really wish death may sooner put me out of my misery.
Thanks, I know how you feel, when you help someone you help them gladly, but when you need help they not there for you, Right?

It’s extremely human to want attention.  We all need attention , almost everything is attention seeking in a way.  It just has a bad connotation because people like to feel superior however they can.  “Attention seeking” behavior usually just means someone doesn’t have their needs met.  So it makes sense that they’d seek attention

theres lots of things wrong with suicide. first, your loved ones or the people youve made an impact on, big or small, will feel that pain of losing you. second, you lose the things worth living for, it can be something small, like ur pet or looking at the sky, but these things may be important to you, and third, humans have a survival instinct because you dont know what happens when your dead, and the fear of that keeps people going. im more scared of losing my consciousness and never knowing because you became nothing, maybe you did become something, but you or others dont know
having a child is both selfish and selfless. it keeps the human race going

I know. I’m the same way.  Rewards are hard to come by.  I feel the same way a lot.  It wasn’t always so bad, and it probably won’t always be as bad as this.  If you live long enough, you go through lonely hard times and relatively good times.  You are in a hard stretch.  Your biggest rewards might not come until you are much older.  You gotta have those little rewards to see you through, though. 
You probably think more about life than other people your age do, so you are naturally going to feel estranged.  Just go with that.  Be angry, be a nihilist and smoke cigarettes and make fun of the idiots.  Don’t kill yourself though. At your age you are guaranteed to be missing out on a lot of rewards if you leave now.  Shot doesn’t get good until 21 or older for most people.  18 if you are lucky.
Maybe you should describe your situation in detail.
You’re more than welcome

What made the classroom unhappy for you? The main thing I haven't liked is how often in adult education that I've experienced instructors who basically read the textbook aloud without adding anything of their own. I felt more at home in Canada as far as climate and feeling secure. In the US, I've met some amazing people but things have been more financially rough.

I do artwork, read (little tidbits of education, not much in the way of books), weightlift, skate, and watch sports.
I prefer ice, but the lack of rinks here makes roller a default. I guess finding a league could be worth a shot.

Urbex is fun and fascinating, just risky with trespassing.

Yep, I'm going for paramedic for sure. I kinda feel that with my degree. I only vaguely remember anything I did in those four years. Science degrees don't do much unless they're 4+ years. I hate research though. Did you ever find it beneficial?

In a way, I do. It's mainly the feeling of being protected. Not just in the be there for you way, but physically. Even though I'm on the smaller/athletic side and a bit geeky, I am attracted to my opposite. Usually heavier people that are outdoorsy. It's not like a fetish. I guess it came from being raised around guys like that. I've given different people a shot, but it hasn't been the greatest time because I feel like I hurt them for a shallow reason. Trust isn't something I'm the best with, but I'm trying to do better.

I get urges to hurt myself again. It's just something that hits me out of nowhere, turn of a switch. Today I ran some errands and did some coursework.
How has your day been?
As an upside, I'm on medication and feeling a bit better.
